ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., ''Thinking of your entire lifetime'' or ''Since April 1, 2020''

ElementDescription: Since April 1, 2020, how frequently have you had alcoholic beverages delivered to your home?
Notes: 1 = Once a week or more often; 2 = Two or three times a month; 3 = Once a month; 4 = Less than once a month but at least once since April 1, 2020; 5 = Never had alcoholic beverages delivered since April 1, 2020

ElementDescription: What types of alcoholic beverages have you had delivered to your house? Check all that apply. (beer)
What types of alcoholic beverages have you had delivered to your house? Check all that apply. (wine)
What types of alcoholic beverages have you had delivered to your house? Check all that apply. (liquor)
Since April 1, 2020, have you increased the stock of alcoholic beverages you keep at home compared to the time before that?
Notes: 1 = Yes, I keep a lot more; 2 = Yes, a little more; 3 = No, about the same; 4 = No, I keep less than before; 5 = I do not keep alcoholic beverages in my home

ElementDescription: Since April 1, 2020, how often have you purchased alcoholic ''to-go'' drinks from restaurants or bars?
Notes: 1 = Once a week or more often; 2 = Two or three times a month; 3 = Once a month; 4 = Less than once a month but at least once since April 1, 2020; 5 = Never bought ''to-go'' drinks since April 1, 2020
